comment: Seems to me that the people that complain about any of the teachers on here being too hard are walking into these classes expecting to be spoon fed and pampered.  It's an Engineering course, this isn't Literature or some pansy Liberal Arts program.  You get out of it what you put into it.  Ortiz is a fantastic teacher as are all the CET teachers.

Dr. Ortiz is my favorite teacher. He truly cares about his students and their progress in his classes. I've taken his classes many times. Yes he is tough and expects students to carry their own weight,, but attend class, take good notes, and you won't have a problem.

He's really interested in the subject. He doesn't require a textbook and his notes are straight forward. His exams are a little tough. He drops the lowest test grade. My test average was a 60 and I somehow managed to get an A so he probably curves too. Definitely would take him again!!

Great teacher! Explains the material very well; however, test problem require that you not only completely understand the material but can apply it to enviromental problems. The tests involve very simple concepts, you just have to understand the material and how to apply it. He is very vague in labs so make sure you ask questions!!

Dr Ortiz is a great teacher, he expects everyone to think outside the box, if you really want to learn the subject take his class, if you just want to get the grade and move on then don't take him.  His test are extremely difficult, but not impossible to get an A in.  The lab reports are really long and feel like busy work.
AVOID HIM LIKE THE PLAGUE. HIS TESTING STANDARDS ARE RIDUICULOUS. NO PARTIAL CREDIT, AND NO HELP WITH ANY OF IT.

Work load...Impossible, Tests...Impossible, Labs...Impossible,Return emails?Never. Fluids is ill advised unless you like failure. I pulled his pass fail rates and his AVG scores are C's at best, hovering around the 65% fail rate. Ortiz blows like a catagory 5 hurricane!

He knows what he teaches. However, talks to much!!! On tests you need to be perfect to be able to pass!!! he makes everything super hard.

This guy really does suck. He was often late to class and almost always cut class short. Seems that he and everyone else were bored. The weekly quizâ€™s were so hard that most people failed most of them. Going to the MET department seems to be the way around this clown.

Avoid this guy like the bird flu. Don't think that just because he is a nice guy that makes him a good professor. His teaching is mediocre at best. The workload is heavy and often pointless. The testing boarders on impossible. You have been warned! !!!!!!!!!!

Ortiz is the only professor I know who would make a 2hr, easy "A" class, into one of the hardest class offered in the CET department.  My fellow classmates and I busted our ass for a whopping failing grade right before the drop date.  When I say whopping, I mean the majority of the class made a 10-40 on the first of three tests.
Sucks! Do not take unless you really want to work hard for a failing grade
